properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A low pressure system over the Gulf of St Lawrence will cross Newfoundland tonight then move out to sea on Wednesday. Snow, blowing snow, and strong gusty northerly winds will develop behind the low tonight. Snowfall amounts near 5 cm are expected along coastal locations however inland and over higher terrain amounts of 10 to 15 cm are forecast. Conditions are expected to improve late in the day on Wednesday. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-16T21:30:45-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-16T13:31:45-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1768432126.2019
Area: Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity, Bay of Exploits, Gander and vicinity, Green Bay - White Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The storm that affected Southern and Central Quebec Sunday evening and Monday is currently over Eastern Quebec. The following is a summary of weather event information received by Environment Canada. 1. Snowfall summary (in centimetres) Roberval: 37 Bagotville: 18 Natashquan: 20 to 30 2. Snow summary by water equivalent in millimetres: Parent: 17 Chevery: 30 (continuing) Blanc-Sablon: 16 (continuing) 3. Summary of wind gusts in kilometres per hour: Île d'Orleans: 87 Chevery area Cape Whittle: 106 Chevery: 83 Blanc-Sablon: 89 ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-16T22:36:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-16T14:37:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2322359729.2019
Area: LG Quatre - Laforge and Fontanges
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Between 10 and 25 centimetres of snow accumulation is expected over these areas by Tuesday morning. Snow will be heavy at times and could therefore quickly accumulate. This accumulation of snow could result in broken tree limbs. The snow will be mixed with ice pellets or rain early this evening over some areas of the Gaspe Peninsula. ### Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-16T16:30:00-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-16T00:31:00-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2477268907.2019
Area: Manic-5 area, Manic-3 area, Chutes-des-Passes - Pipmuacan Reservoir area, Labrieville area, Matane, Grande-Vallée area, Sainte-Anne-des-Monts area, Baie-Trinité area, Sept-Îles - Port-Cartier area, Minganie
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain is expected or occurring. Freezing rain is expected to change to drizzle or freezing drizzle this afternoon as temperatures get close to zero. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-16T19:59:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-16T13:15:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3973351903.2019
Area: Bay of Exploits
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. An additional 15 to 20 centimetres of snow is expected by Wednesday morning. Visibilities could be reduced in snow and blowing snow. ### Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-17T03:43:20-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-16T11:44:20-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3257906851.2019
Area: Murdochville area, Mont-Albert area, Grande-Rivière - Cascapédia area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 20 cm is expected. Total snowfall accumulation of 20 to 25 cm is expected before the snow tapers to flurries this afternoon. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-16T20:59:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-16T13:45:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0810172296.2019
Area: Upper Lake Melville
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. An extended period of snow, blowing snow, and strong winds is expected today and tonight. Snow, heavy at times, will continue today before tapering off this evening. Total snowfall accumulations of 30 to 40 cm are expected in some areas by Wednesday morning, particularly inland and over higher elevations. Strong northeasterly winds gusting to between 70 and 100 km/h will accompany the snow and cause poor visibilities in blowing snow, especially today and tonight. The snow is expected to taper off by Wednesday morning but strong northerly winds will continue through the day on Wednesday. ### Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-17T05:45:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-16T13:46:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1534931740.2019
Area: Red Bay to L'Anse-au-Clair, Norman Bay to Lodge Bay, Eagle River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. A major storm will hit the Lower North Shore tonight and Tuesday. Total accumulations of 30 to 50 centimetres of wet, heavy snow is expected along with high winds. ### Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-16T19:52:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-16T03:53:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0577019823.2019
Area: Natashquan, Chevery, Blanc-Sablon, Anticosti

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. An extended period of snow, blowing snow, and strong winds is expected today through to Wednesday morning. Snow at times heavy will continue today and into tonight. Total snowfall accumulations are expected to reach 40 cm in some areas by Wednesday morning. Strong northeasterly winds gusting up to 100 km/h will accompany the snow and cause poor visibilities in blowing snow. The snow and blowing snow are expected to taper off by Wednesday morning but strong northerly winds will continue through the day on Wednesday. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-17T05:15:15-00:00

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain is expected or occurring. Freezing rain is expected to change to rain inland this afternoon but will likely remain as freezing rain along the coast as temperatures stay just below zero. Freezing rain and rain will transition to snow this evening. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
